intro: Sessea regnellii, commonly known as the African sand dollar, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Sessea regnellii is an important plant in its native habitat, contributing to local biodiversity and ecological balance.
